text: You probably dont have to be the very first to come up with the general idea behind your strategy (if you do that could be some nice money i guess, but its not necessary). Chances are you ll execute it slightly diffrent or maybe combine it with something else.

elements.text: You probably dont have to be the very first to come up with the general idea behind your strategy (if you do that could be some nice money i guess, but its not necessary). Chances are you ll execute it slightly diffrent or maybe combine it with something else.

text: Trying things at random has low chances of success. I suppose you can also make money with solid execution and a combination of well-known indicators, but i doubt it would be the big money nor that its gonna last forever

elements.text: Trying things at random has low chances of success. I suppose you can also make money with solid execution and a combination of well-known indicators, but i doubt it would be the big money nor that its gonna last forever

text: I think you need to change your attitude first, I have been doing this for about 10 years now, many on here have been doing it longer, it takes more than a few months of part time work. Random is a waste of time (as I thought you had already learnt) have you tried modelling what is normal and then going from there?

elements.text: I think you need to change your attitude first, I have been doing this for about 10 years now, many on here have been doing it longer, it takes more than a few months of part time work. Random is a waste of time (as I thought you had already learnt) have you tried modelling what is normal and then going from there?

text: <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> I don't know about specific individuals on here, but I'd imagine those that have been consistent for multiple years probably took multiple years to get to that stage. People don't have one flying lesson and then become airline pilots.

elements.text: I don't know about specific individuals on here, but I'd imagine those that have been consistent for multiple years probably took multiple years to get to that stage. People don't have one flying lesson and then become airline pilots.

text: So yes, been trying normal models, but normal is based on what I think is normal, and ive found backtesting those don't seem very good, in fact doing the opposite of what I think would work is better!

elements.text: So yes, been trying normal models, but normal is based on what I think is normal, and ive found backtesting those don't seem very good, in fact doing the opposite of what I think would work is better!

text:
<@U01PJ5YMFBJ> In my opinion, you are missing an important step. <@UGV299K6H>  has already given you the answer; he said: I"f you want to be really successful it's not about finding some magic combination of obvious parameters, it's about coming to some kind of understanding of market dynamics that other people don't have”

I don’t think you will better that advice. In the many years Ive been doing this, the single stand out attribute/trait of the very successful people Ive met or spoken to is encapsulated in that statement. They think differently having acquired that understanding. Fix that first (yes it may take you years), then move to step two, You cant fast track it

text: Ive been working on variations of a WoM metric along with a new traded volume balance metric, volume traded at prices in the last 10seconds, i scale the metric values depending on how close to midpoint. These metrics combine to form a fair price value, if this is better or worse than current midpoint, then trigger... hedge at close to bsp as i can

text: Actually this conversation and others like it have made me somewhat re-think my advice to new players. In the past I've told people just to write almost any strategy, get some bets on and then work on the results. Although that's right for some people it's obviously not right for everyone.

elements.text: Actually this conversation and others like it have made me somewhat re-think my advice to new players. In the past I've told people just to write almost any strategy, get some bets on and then work on the results. Although that's right for some people it's obviously not right for everyone.

text: My own experience was that I found it relatively easy to get into a little bit of profit and the challenge was scaling, but I think I had a combination of a bit of luck and a bit of aptitude that's not as universal as I assumed it to be.

elements.text: My own experience was that I found it relatively easy to get into a little bit of profit and the challenge was scaling, but I think I had a combination of a bit of luck and a bit of aptitude that's not as universal as I assumed it to be.
